Title: Sians hearts for food

Description: During these unusual times I have been wanting to raise some money for the local food bank. Only two months ago we were living comfortably as a family of four with two full time working incomes, now we are relying on benefits and support from our family to get by. This has made me realise just how quickly things can turn and that so many just now don't have the option of any support. Food banks are so important for so many families not just during this pandemic but every single day. I would love to do some door step portraits for families to capture this unique time. If your family is like mine and sporting many lockdown home hair cuts (including the dogs) then lets capture these special memories forever. All I ask in return is for a donation to the South Ayrshire Food Bank.
Title: Whitney's Doortrait Family door step portraits

Description:
On Monday 11 May starting at 1300 hrs we will attempt a 24hr 417-mile indoor cycling charity challenge in aid of Morecambe Bay Foodbank. We will take our turns to try and make the distance on Zwift! We aim to circumnavigate the Irish Sea.

Stage 1 - Heysham to Liverpool 66.2m    

Stage 2 - Seatruck route from Liverpool – Dublin 136.9m

Stage 3 - Dublin to Warrenpoint 72.4m    

Stage 4 - Seatruck route from Warrenpoint back to Heysham141.5m

We have decided to do this challenge to raise money for the Morecambe Bay Foodbank. 417 miles is a long way and it will be touch and go if we can make it in 24 hrs. The Morecambe Bay Foodbank has always done amazing work but their efforts during the COVID-19 have been incredible.

The Morecambe Bay Foodbank exists to help people in crisis by providing three days' worth of emergency food. They also provide school uniforms to children who need them in the area through our Uniform Project. You help to raise funds to pay for a new van so that they can continue their work. Their old van is getting too small and they need a new one so that they can keep on working to feed and help people in the area.

Thank you for your generosity,

Alistair, Meg, Will & Bess Eagles (Google the dog will be watching!)
Title: The Eagles Family 400 mile 24 hr Zwift Cycle Challenge

Description: We are running a marathon before Mikey's birthday on 6th June to raise money for Lewisham Food Bank to help people affected by the current crisis. Thank you for supporting us!

The people who rely on them can't stock up. Many will be vulnerable in other ways.

Title: Keep Cambridge fed during the coronavirus pandemic

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

I consider myself to be pretty lucky right now, I'm in gainful employment (matter of opinion I guess), have a roof over my head, I'm healthy and I have awesome friends and family.  What I don't have however is access to my hairdresser and desperate times call for desperate measures!

So, I'm going to do something pretty daft.

Given the crazy situation we're in, I decided to try and make my own small contribution to those people who are struggling right now, through no fault of their own.

So here we are, if my colleagues, friends and family can get me to my target, I will get the clippers out and shave my hair!

I feel it would be really helpful for me to handle one though, and I think the incentive of the foodbank getting money from this will spur me on! The foodbank is so vital to so many and I wish it didn't need to exist, but while it does, I hope the spiders can help them a little.

Thank you! x

Description:
The foodbank was there when we really needed it, it was an absolute lifeline.

We dont think anyone in our community should have to face going hungry. Thats why we work with over 100 professional frontline care organisations to provide three days nutritionally balanced emergency food and support to local people who are referred to us in crisis. Manchester Central Foodbank supports people in parts of Central, North, South, and East Manchester. We are part of a nationwide network of foodbanks, supported by The Trussell Trust, working to combat poverty and hunger across the UK.

Money raised for our charity at this year's Great Manchester Run will go towards sustaining and expanding our services, meaning we are closer to reaching everyone who needs us.

Description:
Christmas is a magical time for us at Jam Jar. As a family, we're surrounded by people we love and the magic of it all literally beams out of mini jam jar all the way through December. As a business we get to style some incredible events, and be surrounded by all that sparkles and shimmers. Sadly though, we know that many families on our own doorstep won't have the same feelings about Christmas. The dread of where to find the money for food shouldn't happen to anyone, at any time of year, but especially at christmas. As a mom, a wife and a business, I want to make a little difference to some of the families who need a bit of extra help this year.

I will be donating to the Black Country Food Bank on Tuesday 3rd Decemeber, and anything we raise on this page, I am aiming for £100 which I will match and buy additional donations. You can also leave donations at the studio too.

Please do share! The more of us who make a small donation will make a big difference.

Thanks guys xxx

Description:
For many years the Bonhoeffer Recorder Group has held a twice-yearly concert along with the Crystal Palace & Pimlico Recorder Groups, Suzuki Method Recorder Pupils and solo performances. 

The events include recorder players of all ages from 3yrs old to adults. Every concert raises money for a charity chosen by the host venue, the Dietrich Bonhoeffer Church, Forest Hill. To date the concerts have raised £4627.16 for a wide range of charities.

Sadly due to social distancing we are unable to have our concerts. So we have prepared a virtual performance of Tallis Canon. The charity chosen for this 'virtual' performance is Lewisham Food Bank. They work locally in Forest Hill and are supporting people during the pandemic. Our concerts are only £372.84 away from raising a total of £5,000 so it would be wonderful if we can still reach this goal even if the real concert can't be held. 

We are asking that the usual £4 ticket price is donated to the chosen charity however any donations, however small are welcome.

Description:
WE SMASHED THE TARGET! Thank you so much everybody :) As a reward I will host the replay on my website for a week :) 

http://linuxbrit.co.uk/djpc.html

There are people going hungry in our local community every day, and the issue has been hugely exacerbated by COVID-19. Donating even a small amount could help a family in dire need. Or dig deep and see them through the summer!

I'm hosting a DJ set live on twitch (twitch.tv, it's a free live streaming platform you can watch on your mobile device, laptop or smart tv) on Wednesday July 8th from 19:00-20:30 BST and will ask for donations in return - think of it as your admission ticket. 

I taught myself how to do this the year before last, so I'm only an enthusiastic amateur - I may even embarrass myself! Either way it should be a fun 90 minutes!


We're calling it: Go big and stay home!

So let's turn the volume up, have a virtual house party, let our hair down and maybe even crack open a beer (or your favourite non alcoholic beverage) or two!

Even if you can't make it please think about supporting this important cause.

Joining instructions:

The URL is: https://www.twitch.tv/djtomgilbert 

You might want to create a twitch account if you don't have one, then you can subscribe to notifications when the channel airs. You can watch on phone/ipad/laptop or even cast it to your smart TV if you have one!

If I get disconnected (rural ADSL) I will rejoin within a few minutes so just refresh the twitch page. 

Tom.

Title: Food for thought at Christmas

Description:
I am organising a food drive and fundraiser for the Cambridge City Food Bank. Winter can be very difficult for those in our communities who are struggling, and the holidays can exacerbate that. The Food Bank is seeded by the Trussell Trust and provides food, sanitary and household supplies, and meter cards for gas and electricity to people in need. Food bank use is at an all-time high in the UK and your donations of food and money will go a long way. This winter, help people who are forced to decide to 'heat or eat', and bring some holiday comfort to people in need! Here's how you can help:

1. Donate food. If you are based in the Department of Archaeology, please take part in our food drive. There is a box in the coffee room for supplies and updated shopping lists from the Food Bank alongside it.

2. Donate money, either at the Department reception or using this page.

You can get more info about the Cambridge City Food Bank here: https://cambridgecity.foodbank.org.uk/

Thank you for your donations!

Title: Ross's First time shaving in 8 years

Description:
During June the Barclays private cloud team us getting together (virtually of course) to help a local foodbank, the Trussell trust – Manchester branch. They are experiencing a large increase in demand for their services combined with a fall in donations due to covid 19.  Although we are all working from home for the foreseeable future and can’t get together to do the usual cake sales, fun runs and other fundraising events we are all coming together as a team to do a virtuall commute and make a difference.

How do I get involved I hear you say!!! Missing your commute???? I thought so!!!!

  • ·       We have this team justgiving page - To gather donations and sponsorship from the team, maybe donate some of the money saved from this weeks commuting or money saved from cancelled sporting events.  Even better Barclays will double anything we raise!
  • Download strava, search for and join the club "private cloud team" . And use strava to log all our collective activities.
  • We will add up all of our efforts to see which is the furthest Barclays office we can commute!
Title: Barclays Private Cloud Team Challenge

Description:
After a mixture of wanting to take part in the charitable challenges, and also wanting to do something to help those less fortunate in these lockdown days days... I decided to set a challenge to some friends. There are several great efforts going on to raise money for the NHS charities, so I thought i’d go with something that is local to many of my friends and colleagues - this is the area right next to Dell Glasgow (remember that place!?)

Challenge is simple (but not easy!) & for the golfers out there, but anyone can try it!

Just like several similar challenges, the golfer needs to get 20 balls, place a bucket, basin or plant pot etc. 10 feet away. Film yourself hitting all 20 and for everyone you get in the bucket - donate (a minimum) of £2.00 to the just giving page below.

https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/carlo-cocozza

The idea is to get a lot of people taking part, so please post your video and nominate another garden golfer!

If you are tagged in this, you are nominated 😉 good luck!

Eg get 1 out of 20, donate £2 (or whatever you choose).
Get none in, donate at least £2 anyway. Every ‘ball in the bucket’ could be a meal for someone.

Description:
Facebook event: https://www.facebook.com/events/2937274356352920/

Lancaster University Running & Athletics club invites you to participate in our ‘Run of the Roses’ charity event. Fundraising for the Morecambe Bay Foodbank, we want Lancaster University’s clubs and societies to try and collectively cover the 170 miles ‘Way of the Roses’ by completing activities between Wednesday 20th - Sunday 31st. This could be through running, walking, stair climbing, lunging or whatever exercise you fancy, and recording the distance you travel. We want clubs, societies and individuals to try and collectively run 170miles, with members then sharing their individual distances to add to their group’s total. Don’t forget to tag your club in your donation comment! 

We want to see how much money we can raise for such a vital cause, and of course how many laps of the ‘Way of the Roses’ that Lancaster University can achieve! There will be prizes for the society that raises the most money and completes the most distance! Interested? For more information, please head over to our FB event page!
Title: Lancaster University's Run of the Roses

Description:

Each week during lockdown I have been bringing our local Meadowbank Social Club quiz to our Facebook page for all to enjoy.

These times have brought difficult situations for all and as a local peoples club I find it only fitting to help those in desperate need at this time. 

The coronavirus lockdown has triggered an unprecedented rise in food bank use as the economy was hit and household incomes plunged, data from hundreds of emergency food aid charities reveals. With some food banks seeing a 59% increase in use! 1 in 5 people in the uk live below the poverty line.

Even if only £1 every penny helps and shall help a family in need.

Thank you all for your support and I and all at meadowbank hope you are keeping safe.

Title: Alexis's 45 Burpees

Description:
Each year Enable choses a local charity to support through various fundraising activities throughout the year.

This year might be a little trickier than some, but we're still determined to raise money for the Stratford upon Avon Foodbank.  In fact, we know that now, more than ever, they need our support to help vulnerable people cope through the COVID-19 pandemic.

So, stand by for the classic bake off, virtual quizzes and, we hope, a bigger event towards the end of this year!

The SuA Foodbank is part of The Trussell Trust’s network of 428 foodbanks, working to tackle food poverty and hunger in local communities, as well as across the UK.

The Foodbank Network was founded in 2004 after four years of developing the original foodbank based in Salisbury. Since then The Trussell Trust has helped communities work together to launch foodbanks nationwide in a wide range of towns and cities.

In 2018/19, The Trussell Trust’s Foodbank Network provided 1,583,668 three-day emergency food supplies and support to UK people in crisis. Of these, 577,618 went to children.

Title: Our Huddle of Hope

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

We're in the grip of an international emergency and all of our lives have changed. We're facing new challenges, and restrictions, and it can get tough for us all at times, in different ways. With increased financial insecurity for many, many more people right now will be finding themselves in food poverty, and will be turning to the Foodbanks to help get them through this most difficult of times.

Skinner & T'witch have set up a Pick n' Mix Online Social Club on Facebook, as a place for other artists and ourselves to share our music and find a new audience; for viewers to find entertainment and hopefully feel less isolated; and a place to raise money for the Foodbanks.

In addition to the marvellous home videos that artists will be posting on the Online Social Club page, we (Skinner & T'witch) will be hosting weekly events on Sunday nights from 7-9pm UK (2-4pm US ET/Mondays 5-7am AUS ET). This will include fortnightly singarounds and fortnightly artist showcases (in rotation), and live sessions from Skinner & T'witch. 

Please donate whatever and whenever you can. Every little helps. Every £1 matters. Thank you so much for your support with this.

The previous situation with Leeds' Foodbanks (now exacerbated by the current crisis) was, as follows: 'Several issues have resulted the rise in demand, but...changes in benefit payments are the main reason people resort to using food banks...around 50 to 60 per cent of clients use food banks for this reason...Much of this is due to the move to Universal Credit, which can mean weeks without payment for some claimants...It is also because of changes to tax credits and other entitlements which working families make use of. People on low incomes because of zero-hours contracts and part-time work are also frequent clients...along with those suffering debt - often because of gas and electric bills. Other reasons also contribute to people’s need for food banks, such as those who are having to escape domestic abuse’.

Donate at any time via: www.leedsnorthandwest.foodbank.org.uk

www.leedssouthandeast.foodbank.org.uk

Stay safe, folks! Together, we'll get through this!!

Title: SMF December Fundraising

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

As a family this year we have decided to help our local food bank through the Trussell Trust and are asking our friends and family to donate anything they can to help feed families over Christmas.

We don’t think anyone in our community should have to face going hungry. That’s why we provide three days’ nutritionally balanced emergency food and support to local people who are referred to us in crisis. We are part of a nationwide network of foodbanks, supported by The Trussell Trust, working to combat poverty and hunger across the UK.

ABOUT THE FOODBANK NETWORK

The Trussell Trust supports communities and churches to open foodbanks across the UK. 

Our foodbank is part of The Trussell Trust’s network of 428 foodbanks, working to tackle food poverty and hunger in our local communities, as well as across the UK.

The Foodbank Network was founded in 2004 after four years of developing the original foodbank based in Salisbury. Since then The Trussell Trust has helped communities work together to launch foodbanks nationwide in a wide range of towns and cities.

In 2018/19, The Trussell Trust’s Foodbank Network provided 1,583,668 three-day emergency food supplies and support to UK people in crisis. Of these, 577,618 went to children.

As a network, we want to see more people helped out of crisis and fewer people needing foodbanks in the future. That’s why The Trussell Trust and local foodbanks are working together to develop new ways to help people out of crisis through programmes like More Than Food.

To find out more about The Trussell Trust visit www.trusselltrust.org.

Description:
Yes, I'm at it again and I am (a little) sorry for asking for sponsorship again but I am keeping this really simple.  I've been getting up really early and running 10km every day since 22nd March. On October 7th, if I don't get ill or injured, I will make it to day 200, (2,000km), without a rest day. Please can you sponsor me 1p for every 10k that I have done - i.e. £2? This is less than a saved bus / train / tube fare in the last few months but if I can get 100 people to do it then I'll get to £200 which will make a real difference to the food bank that is sadly becoming more and more vital for people. I know I asked for sponsorship for my birthday last year, and I purposefully didn't ask for sponsorship again when I started this because I felt it was too close to my birthday, but now I am much closer to my next birthday than my last one so, why not? :-)

Please sponsor me £2 and then please share with as many people as you can and let's see what we can do.

We are raising money for the food bank here in leeds as with the current economic environment, due to the virus and unemployment they need support more than ever. CharityName: Pye Green Christian Centre - Cannock and District foodbank
Description:
No-one in our wealthy country should be hungry. Our local foodbanks do an amazing job for those in need. we As a family wanted to give up something we love, something that would impact on our enjoyment. We are not big drinkers, we don’t smoke. However, we do absolutely love chocolate, cake, sweets and treats (especially the twins). Therefore we are going totally sugar free for January to raise money for our local foodbank. January is a hard time for many families, not just the ones out of work, even working families are using our foodbanks. So donate to our page please. Let’s make a difference. We will keep you updated with our progress along the way. I’m super proud of the twins for agreeing to this, although I don’t think they really realise that sugar is everywhere 🤣🤣🤣


Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: The Becketts are going sugar free for January
